intro: Arctotis scapigera, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with blue or purple petals and a yellow center, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Arctotis scapigera is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
